name: property
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: property
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an object or objects that belong to someone

example.eg: The club does not accept responsibility for loss of or damage to club members' personal property.
example.egtrans: 该俱乐部不承担会员个人财产丢失或损坏的责任。

example.eg: Both books have "Government property" stamped inside them.
example.egtrans: 这两本书里都盖着“政府财产”的印章。

example.eg: Children need to be taught to have respect for other people's property.
example.egtrans: 应该教育孩子尊重他人的财产。

trans_examp.trans_en: a building or area of land, or both together

example.eg: He owns a number of properties on the south coast.
example.egtrans: 他在南部海滨拥有几处房产。

example.eg: The notice said "Private property - keep off!"
example.egtrans: 布告上写着“私人地产，请勿擅入”。

example.eg: Yes, I've bought my own house - I'm now a man/woman of property!
example.egtrans: 是的，我买了房子——我现在是有产阶级了！

trans_examp.trans_en: the legal right to own and use something

dsense.name: property
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a quality in a substance or material, especially one that means that it can be used in a particular way

example.eg: One of the properties of copper is that it conducts heat and electricity very well.
example.egtrans: 铜的特性之一是导热导电能力强。

example.eg: We value herbs for their taste, but we forget that they also have medicinal properties.
example.egtrans: 我们因为草本植物的味道而珍视它们，不过我们忘了它们还有药用价值。
